questions.question: Data drift occurs when:
options: Production input data distribution changes compared to training data
questions.explanation: Data drift means the real-world data your model sees in production has shifted from what it was trained on, potentially degrading performance.

questions.question: Concept drift differs from data drift because:
options: The relationship between inputs and correct outputs changes, not just the inputs
questions.explanation: Concept drift means the definition of 'correct' has changed. For example, customer preferences shift over time, making old predictions wrong even if the data looks similar.

questions.question: User feedback (thumbs up/down, corrections) can be used to improve AI models over time.
questions.explanation: Human feedback creates labeled data for fine-tuning, identifies failure patterns, and helps prioritize improvement areas — this is the basis of RLHF.
